tool.name: MAUS Align
tool.command: ln -s "${signal}" input.wav && /home/maus/maus OUTFORMAT=mau LANGUAGE=$language BPF=$bpf INSKANTEXTGRID=$inskantextgrid INSORTTEXTGRID=$insorttextgrid MODUS=$modus MAUSSHIFT=$mausshift MINPAUSLEN=$minpauslen WEIGHT=$weight INSPROB=$insprob NOINITIALFINALSILENCE=$noinitialfinalsilence OUTSYMBOL=$outsymbol OUT=$output SIGNAL=input.wav

param.name: inskantextgrid
param.label: Add canonical phonemic transcription to TextGrid output

param.name: modus
param.label: Mode
param.option: Do not model pronunciation, align the given phonemic transcript
Use phone recognition constrained by a Bigram model

param.name: mausshift
param.label: Shift found segment boundaries by this many milliseconds

param.name: minpauslen
param.label: supress inter-word silence less than n*10ms, ie. enter 5 here to suppress silence less than 50ms

param.name: weight
param.label: relative weight given to statistical model, higher values will favour the canonical pronunciation

param.name: insprob
param.label: Insertion probability - higher values will reduce the probability of deletions of phonemic segments

tool.help: Run the MAUS forced aligner on an audio file given a transcription in BPF format. Output is a TextGrid file containing the phonemic annotation with start/end times for each segment.
